text.p: Microsoft Corp Tuesday announced the availability of the beta version of CryptoAPI 2.0, software that allows developers to add strong security to existing and future software programs.
In a statement, Microsoft said the software is available for download on the Internet's World Wide Web (http://www.microsoft.com /intdev/security/).

Microsoft said the software provides the underlying technology necessary to add security features to applications, such as the ability to sign a document digitally and send it over the Internet network of computer networks, or verify an individual's identity in an exchange of personal, financial or medical information.
Separately, Microsoft said more than 50 independent software companies are already supporting Microsoft's code-signing technology, Authenticode, since its availability in August.
Using certificates such as VeriSign's Software Publisher Digital IDs, Authenticode identifies the publisher of a piece of software and verifies that the software has not been tampered with.
